name: Perreyve Hotel

reviews.title: Good Value Hotel in Paris
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Perreyve in December of 1999 and had a very good experience there. The staff was courteous and helpful, the room was small, but very clean and quiet, and the location was quite convenient to everything that a first-time visitor to Paris wants to see. Highly recommended to those on a slim budget - which was why I was in Paris at Christmas!

I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights this september. The rooms are incredibly small but ok just a little bar of soap and very annoying toilet paper (which could definitly be changed for regular type) The walls are very thin. There are not enough channels on the TV for english speakers, just BBC! The added breakfast to the price was very nice. In all a basic hotel but so central and convenient for the whole of central Paris and especially of course the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg. For the price I think I would have preferred something cheaper and basic. Our room only had a bath which for the price should have a shower too.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but room for improvement

likes.disliked: — tiny rooms TV toilet wasnt flushing as it should and wasnt always enough hot water

reviews.text: We went to Paris for a two night getaway with the kids. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews. I was so disappointed upon arrival.
reviews.title: Disappointing and disgusting

reviews.text: The lobby had huge water stains all over the wallpaper and things looked very shabby. In our room the walls were stained and filthy and the bathrooms weren't much better. The only toiletry given was a wrapped bar of soap. The linens were OK. I was very disappointed (were the other reviewers at the same hotel??), and then at 4:30 am I was awakened by a bunch of guys in the next room who were returning from a night of partying. Lots of noise; I could hear them vomiting!! That was enough for me. We left.
reviews.title: Sweet little gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy efficient booking with instant email confirmation. Reception staff outstanding, each one acting as if they owned the place (in the nicest of ways). Small rooms, but perfectly sufficient. Lovely clean, comfy beds with fresh, crisp linen. Pillows not great but after a long day of walking the incredibly beautiful sights of Paris, I was so tired that it didn't seem an issue. Some rooms have showers but I had a bath tub, so my advice is to take a little bit of bubble bath with you (and pick up a bottle of the 'other' bubbly at the local store) run a hot bath for that exhausted body and aching feet and you'll be in heaven! Perfect location too; close to Saint Sulplice and Jardins de Luxembourg. Breakfast is more than ample, with juice, coffee, croissants and fresh baguettes for just 6 Euro.
reviews.title: A really good 2 star hotel

likes.disliked: — downstairs toilet in reception didn't work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Perreyve for a long weekend. The only reason I think it is classed as a 2 star is because it doesn't have a bar. But this doesn't matter, because there are loads of bars, cafes and restuarants near the hotel.
reviews.title: Exactly what you pay for

reviews.text: A friend booked this hotel because she had stayed here during a previous visit. This place was a dump. The lobby was nice enough, but they were painting, and the paint fumes were everywhere. The stairs where covered with tarps for painting making using them very dangerous, and the extremely small elevator (one person and luggage) was terrible. The carpet in the room was filthy with stains, and I had to put an extra blanket under one side of my twin bed because the mattress was so worn out, I kept rolling to the side. The staff was the only redeeming factor, very friendly and tried to be helpful. Although the bathroom seemed clean enough, it didn't make up for the gross carpeting and the fact that ongoing construction started early in the morning. Not a bad location, but I would not stay here again, even when all the improvements are completed.
reviews.title: I would never stay here again

reviews.text: It was so bad that we left, not before having to pay full price for the room. The room was in a terrible state, the bathroom pretty disgusting but the worst thing was the smell. As mentioned by others, it was being renovated and there is no way it should have remained open. Scaffolding and sheets blocked any kind of view and the staff were pretty unimpressed with our complaints. They refused to move us to another room. So we moved across the road to Hotel L'Avenir which was so much better. The location of these hotels is excellent, right by the gardens and once the Hotel Perreyve is modernised, who knows it might be a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Disaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel should have been closed during repairs. First, from outside, it was in renovation. You go in and you immediately notice there's a moisture problem, you see stains in the walls and you give it the benefit of the doubt; electric cables coming out of the walls, ac machines open and coming out of the walls as well. The whole hotel was trashed inside out with cables, the rooms were nasty smelly with moisture. The service was very bad; we asked to change rooms because it smelled like pee, they gave us another room, we left for the day, when we came back we realized somebody had picked up all our stuff including intimate stuff and put it in another room, worse than the first and the second. We were more bothered by the fact that they thought it was right to touch our clothes. I have pictures to prove this nightmarish hotel.
reviews.title: Mediocricy, neglect, danger and bad smell.

reviews.text: We needed to stay somewhere in Paris that didn't cost a fortune, was handy for a business meeting, and convenient for attractions. This hotel ticked all these boxes. Our room was small, but clean and fresh. the bathroom was tres bijou but perfectly adequate, after all you don't travel to Paris and spend all day in the bathroom!
reviews.title: Great Location - Hotel Perfectly Acceptable

reviews.text: The location is excellent, very quiet and safe and on the doorstep of the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. Just a ten minute walk through the Gardens from the RER station at Luxembourg Gardens - very handy if you have flown in from CDG airport. Lots of attractions within walking distance There are some lovely patisseries just round the corner and great shopping in Montparnasse (a trip up the tower is highly recommended - views just a good as the Eiffel tower and no queues).
reviews.title: caught a cold due to the need to open windows at nights

likes.disliked: — internet did not work in sixth floor, nor did the heating, construction work, small and narrow, not too clean

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights in May. This is a GREAT little hotel. It's more for your budget type accomodation but it's very clean and the rooms are really cute and very French. The service is excellent as everyone that works there are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is also great .... I had it one morning to try and it's served in their cute little dining room and is just what you need. The location is also perfect .... right near Jardin due Luxembourg (such a beautiful park) and a nice walk from Notre Dame, Pantheon, St Suplice is right around the corner. The Latin Quarter is a great area to stay in and I was in Paris for a week (I had to stay at two hotels due to it being a busy time ... other hotel was Hotel des Mines also wonderful, same area, slightly more new and modern and bigger).
reviews.title: Great little hotel!!! Perfect location!!!

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for its location and value for money. The rooms were lovely and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They also held our bags for us, nice and safely for a whole day before I had to switch hotels. They were wonderful!!!
reviews.title: Excellent functional base
Small but charming
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in October 2004 (after looking at a million sites and an extensive search on the web) and found the staff at the hotel to be friendly and helpful without interfering in our daily coming and going. We arrived on an evening flight and arrived after 11:00 pm. Our room was ready and the night porter checked us in. On our final day we vacated the room in the morning, and the Hotel was very willing to store our baggage whilst we went on a last chance to see excursion.

reviews.title: Charming and Great Location!
reviews.text: The room itself is small, but clean and functional. The decor in the hotel is old fashioned but quaint and totally acceptable (some other 3 star hotels in the area will make you run a mile away with the overdone interior wallpaper and rose patterns on the drapes - yuck!). We especially loved the fact that the doors to the outside street could open - thereby allowing in some nighttime air. It is a 2 star hotel, so don't expect glitter and glamour - you'd need at least 400 EUR per night to get that!. The saving in price is worth it for spending more time and money on those romantic late afternoon wine sipping, people watching sessions.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: We did not opt for breakfast since there are quite a few patisseries in the area. The metro is close by - but difficult to negotiate at first since you enter and exit in different areas. The positioning was perfect in that we could easily hop back to the hotel in the late afternoons for a quick freshen up (and a glass of wine or two :-) before going on an evening excursion. As a base, the Hotel was perfectly located.

description: The Hôtel Perreyve is a family owned hotel, that combines the charm of a 1901 building with modern comforts (Air Conditioning, private bathroom, LCD TV with international channels, free WiFi access in all rooms etc). We are a stone’s throw-away from the quiet « Luxembourg Garden » and connected to Paris areas and suburbs via public transportation including the subway system (subway stations of St Placide, Notre Dame des Champs…), buses (83, 27, 91…).
